title: Events Instruction Letter (IMIC-S510-05)(IMIC-S510-05) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No IMIC-S510-05-V04 Effective Date 08-03-2012 Update Date 12-06-2024 Related Unit / Owner MIC / Pazarlama ve Kurumsal İletişim Direktörlüğü Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim To determine the principles and rules to be followed when organizing all types of institutional events at Sabancı University. Scope Covers events related to Sabancı University's faculties, centers, forums, administrative and academic units, students, faculty members, and alumni. Principle It must be an event that complies with Sabancı University's philosophy and principles, activity plan, and unit and budget targets. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations Definitions / Abbreviations MIC: Marketing and Institutional Communications Directorate SU: Sabancı University POP: Procurement and Operations Directorate SER: Services Group Directorate Third Party: The company or individual responsible for providing services during the event Event: Institutional events planned within the framework of Sabancı University's annual marketing and communications plan or planned to be held by SU units at any time of the year outside of this plan. Regulations 1. Institutional events within Sabancı University's Marketing and Communications plan are planned by MIC within the framework of the annual integrated event calendar. Events to be organized by individual units are submitted to MIC via the MIC request form and/or email and are included in the annual integrated event calendar. 2. During the event planning phase, MIC organizes meetings with the relevant unit. During these meetings, detailed information is obtained regarding the event's time, location, guest groups, format, and program flow. MIC provides comments and suggestions on all these matters. 3. Based on the information received, MIC prepares the time, budget, and event plan and agrees on the plan with the relevant unit. The unit responsible for the event's budget, or MIC, initiates the purchasing process with the POP and provides guidance, if needed, during the selection of relevant suppliers. Operational processes are initiated with the company to be worked with based on the purchasing tender results. 4. Requirements related to on-campus events are conveyed to POP by MIC or the relevant unit hosting the event. If third-party collaboration is necessary during the event, MIC, in collaboration with the POP, obtains bids from suitable third parties and selects the most suitable company. If necessary, coordination is ensured between the SAO and the third party. For off-campus events, all procedures are carried out with the relevant suppliers. 5. The relevant units coordinate and complete the workflow, plans, and checklists prepared before, during, and after MIC events. Related Procedures Related Forms Related Form Links
